questions.question: Which AWS service helps identify malicious or unauthorized activities in AWS accounts and workloads?
questions.explanation: Amazon GuardDuty is a threat detection service that continuously monitors AWS accounts and workloads for malicious or unauthorized activity, such as compromised instances or suspicious API calls.

questions.question:
A company wants to try a third-party ecommerce solution before deciding to use it long term.
Which AWS service or tool will support this effort?
questions.explanation: AWS Marketplace provides a digital catalog of third-party software, including ecommerce platforms, that can be quickly deployed and tested on AWS before committing to long-term use.

questions.question: Which AWS service is a managed NoSQL database?
questions.explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL key-value and document database designed for high performance, scalability, and low-latency access.

questions.question: Which AWS service should be used to create a billing alarm?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudWatch can be used to create billing alarms that notify users when estimated charges exceed defined thresholds.

questions.question:
A company is hosting a web application in a Docker container on Amazon EC2.
AWS is responsible for which of the following tasks?

options.text: Scaling the web application and services developed with Docker
Provisioning or scheduling containers to run on clusters and maintain their availability
Performing hardware maintenance in the AWS facilities that run the AWS Cloud
Managing the guest operating system, including updates and security patches

questions.explanation: Under the shared responsibility model, AWS is responsible for maintaining and securing the physical infrastructure, including hardware and facilities, while customers manage their applications and operating systems.

questions.question:
Users are reporting latency when connecting to a website with a global customer base.
Which AWS service will improve the customer experience by reducing latency?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a content delivery network (CDN) that caches content at global edge locations, reducing latency for users around the world.

questions.question: Which actions represent best practices for using AWS IAM? (Choose two.)

options.text: Share the security credentials among users of AWS accounts who are in the same Region
Use access keys to log in to the AWS Management Console
Rotate access keys on a regular basis
Avoid using IAM roles to delegate permissions

questions.explanation: IAM best practices include enforcing strong password policies and rotating access keys regularly to reduce the risk of compromised credentials.

questions.question: Which AWS feature or service can be used to capture information about incoming and outgoing traffic in an AWS VPC infrastructure?
questions.explanation: VPC Flow Logs capture information about the IP traffic going to and from network interfaces in a VPC, enabling network monitoring and troubleshooting.

questions.question:
A company wants to use an AWS service to monitor the health of application endpoints, with the ability to route traffic to healthy regional endpoints to improve application availability.
Which service will support these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Global Accelerator continuously monitors endpoint health and routes traffic to the closest healthy endpoint using the AWS global network, improving availability and performance.

questions.question: According to the AWS Well-Architected Framework, what change management steps should be taken to achieve reliability in the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)

options.text: Use AWS Config to generate an inventory of AWS resources
Use service limits to prevent users from creating or making changes to AWS resources
Use AWS CloudTrail to record AWS API calls into an auditable log file
Use AWS Certificate Manager to whitelist approved AWS resources and services
Use Amazon GuardDuty to validate configuration changes made to AWS resources

questions.explanation: AWS Config provides an inventory and configuration history of resources, while AWS CloudTrail logs API calls, enabling traceability and reliable change management.

questions.question: Which service can be used to monitor and receive alerts for AWS account root user AWS Management Console sign-in events?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudWatch can trigger alarms and notifications when root user sign-in events occur, improving security monitoring.

questions.question: Which design principle should be considered when architecting in the AWS Cloud?

options.text: Think of servers as non-disposable resources
Implement the least permissive rules for security groups

questions.explanation: Designing loosely coupled components ensures that failures or changes in one part of an application do not affect other parts, improving resilience and scalability.

questions.question: Which AWS services can be used to move data from on-premises data centers to AWS? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: AWS Snowball transfers large amounts of physical data to AWS, while AWS Database Migration Service (DMS) migrates databases from on-premises to AWS.

questions.question:
A batch workload takes 5 hours to finish on an Amazon EC2 instance. The amount of data to be processed doubles monthly and the processing time is proportional.
What is the best cloud architecture to address this consistently growing demand?

options.text: Run the application on a bigger EC2 instance size.
Switch to an EC2 instance family that better matches batch requirements.
Distribute the application across multiple EC2 instances and run the workload in parallel.
Run the application on a bare metal EC2 instance.

questions.explanation: Distributing workloads across multiple EC2 instances allows the job to be processed in parallel, enabling horizontal scaling to handle increasing data volumes.

questions.question:
Each department within a company has its own independent AWS account and its own payment method. New company leadership wants to centralize departmental governance and consolidate payments.
How can this be achieved using AWS services or features?

options.text: Forward monthly invoices for each account. Then create IAM roles to allow cross-account access.
Create a new AWS account. Then configure AWS Organizations and invite all existing accounts to join.
Configure AWS Organizations in each of the existing accounts. Then link all accounts together.
Use Cost Explorer to combine costs from all accounts. Then replicate IAM policies across accounts.

questions.explanation: AWS Organizations allows multiple AWS accounts to be centrally governed and billed together, enabling consolidated payments and centralized policies.

questions.question: The ability to horizontally scale Amazon EC2 instances based on demand is an example of which concept in the AWS Cloud value proposition?
questions.explanation: Elasticity allows AWS resources such as EC2 instances to scale in or out automatically based on demand.

questions.question:
An ecommerce company anticipates a huge increase in web traffic for two very popular upcoming shopping holidays.
Which AWS service or feature can be configured to dynamically adjust resources to meet this change in demand?
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling automatically adjusts the number of running instances to match changes in traffic and workload demand.

questions.question: Which AWS service enables users to securely connect to AWS resources over the public internet?
questions.explanation: AWS VPN provides encrypted connections over the public internet between on-premises networks and AWS resources.

questions.question: Which tool is used to forecast AWS spending?
questions.explanation: AWS Cost Explorer analyzes historical spending and forecasts future AWS costs based on usage trends.

questions.question:
A company is running an ecommerce application hosted in Europe. To decrease latency for users who access the website from other parts of the world, the company would like to cache frequently accessed static content closer to the users.
Which AWS service will support these requirements?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudFront caches static content at edge locations around the world, reducing latency for global users.

questions.question: Which of the following is a component of the AWS Global Infrastructure?
questions.explanation: AWS Regions are part of the global infrastructure and consist of multiple Availability Zones in a specific geographic area.

questions.question: Which AWS service will help users determine if an application running on an Amazon EC2 instance has sufficient CPU capacity?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudWatch monitors metrics such as CPU utilization, allowing users to determine if EC2 instances have sufficient capacity.

questions.question: Why is it beneficial to use Elastic Load Balancers with applications?

options.text: They allow for the conversion from Application Load Balancers to Classic Load Balancers.
They are capable of handling constant changes in network traffic patterns.
They are provided at no charge to users.

questions.explanation: Elastic Load Balancers are designed to handle changing traffic patterns and distribute requests across multiple targets for reliability and performance.

questions.question: Which tasks are the customer's responsibility in the AWS shared responsibility model? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Customers are responsible for managing their application configurations and defining security group rules, while AWS manages the underlying infrastructure.

questions.question:
IT systems should be designed to reduce interdependencies, so that a change or failure in one component does not cascade to other components.
This is an example of which principle of cloud architecture design?
questions.explanation: Loose coupling minimizes dependencies between components, preventing failures in one part of the system from impacting others.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature can enhance network security by blocking requests from a particular network for a web application on AWS? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: AWS WAF blocks malicious or unwanted web requests, while Network ACLs control traffic at the subnet level, enhancing network security.

questions.question:
An application runs on multiple Amazon EC2 instances that access a shared file system simultaneously.
Which AWS storage service should be used?
questions.explanation: Amazon EFS provides a scalable, shared file system that can be mounted by multiple EC2 instances simultaneously.

questions.question:
A web application is hosted on AWS using an Elastic Load Balancer, multiple Amazon EC2 instances, and Amazon RDS.
Which security measures fall under the responsibility of AWS? (Choose two.)

options.text: Running a virus scan on EC2 instances
Protecting against IP spoofing and packet sniffing
Installing the latest security patches on the RDS instance
Encrypting communication between the EC2 instances and the Elastic Load Balancer
Configuring a security group and a network access control list (NACL) for EC2

questions.explanation: AWS is responsible for protecting its network against threats like IP spoofing and for managing patching of managed services such as Amazon RDS.

questions.question: What is the benefit of elasticity in the AWS Cloud?

options.text: Ensure web traffic is automatically spread across multiple AWS Regions.
Minimize storage costs by automatically archiving log data.
Enable AWS to automatically select the most cost-effective services.
Automatically adjust the required compute capacity to maintain consistent performance.

questions.explanation: Elasticity allows AWS to automatically adjust compute resources to maintain consistent application performance.

questions.question: The continual reduction of AWS Cloud pricing is due to:
questions.explanation: Economies of scale allow AWS to reduce prices over time as its global infrastructure and customer base grow.

questions.question:
A company needs an Amazon S3 bucket that cannot have any public objects due to compliance requirements.
How can this be accomplished?

options.text: Enable S3 Block Public Access from the AWS Management Console.
Hold a team meeting to discuss the importance if only uploading private S3 objects.
Require all S3 objects to be manually approved before uploading.
Create a service to monitor all S3 uploads and remove any public uploads.

questions.explanation: S3 Block Public Access ensures that no objects in an S3 bucket can be made public, helping meet compliance requirements.

questions.question:
A Cloud Practitioner identifies a billing issue after examining the AWS Cost and Usage report in the AWS Management Console.
Which action can be taken to resolve this?

options.text: Open a detailed case related to billing and submit it to AWS Support for help.
Upload data describing the issue to a new object in a private Amazon S3 bucket.
Create a pricing application and deploy it to a right-sized Amazon EC2 instance for more information.
Proceed with creating a new dashboard in Amazon QuickSight.

questions.explanation: Billing issues can be resolved by opening a billing support case with AWS Support directly from the Management Console.

questions.question: What does the AWS Simple Monthly Calculator do?

options.text: Compares on-premises costs to colocation environments
Estimates monthly billing based on projected usage
Estimates power consumption at existing data centers

questions.explanation: The AWS Simple Monthly Calculator estimates monthly AWS costs based on expected service usage.

questions.question: Who is responsible for patching the guest operating system for Amazon RDS?
questions.explanation: In Amazon RDS, the customer is responsible for managing and patching the database engine and configuration, including OS-level concerns relevant to the database.

questions.question: Which AWS services may be scaled using AWS Auto Scaling? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 and Amazon DynamoDB can be configured to scale automatically using AWS Auto Scaling based on demand.

questions.question: Which of the following are benefits of AWS Global Accelerator? (Choose two.)

options.text: Reduced cost to run services on AWS
Improved availability of applications deployed on AWS
Higher durability of data stored on AWS
Decreased latency to reach applications deployed on AWS
Higher security of data stored on AWS

questions.explanation: AWS Global Accelerator improves application availability and reduces latency by routing users through the AWS global network to the closest healthy endpoint.

questions.question: A user who wants to get help with billing and reactivate a suspended account should submit an account and billing request to:
questions.explanation: AWS Support handles billing issues, account reactivation, and other account-related problems.

questions.question: Which AWS Cloud best practice uses the elasticity and agility of cloud computing?

options.text: Provision capacity based on past usage and theoretical peaks
Dynamically and predictively scale to meet usage demands
Build the application and infrastructure in a data center that grants physical access
Break apart the application into loosely coupled components

questions.explanation: Dynamic and predictive scaling allows cloud resources to grow or shrink automatically based on real usage, avoiding overprovisioning.

questions.question: Which method helps to optimize costs of users moving to the AWS Cloud?

options.text: Paying only for what is used
Purchasing hardware before it is needed
Purchasing for the maximum possible load

questions.explanation: Paying only for the resources actually used allows customers to optimize costs when moving to the AWS Cloud.

questions.question: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, which of the following is a customer responsibility?

options.text: Installing security patches for the Xen and KVM hypervisors
Installing operating system patches for Amazon DynamoDB
Installing operating system security patches for Amazon EC2 database instances
Installing operating system security patches for Amazon RDS database instances

questions.explanation: For Amazon EC2, the customer is responsible for patching and securing the guest operating system.

questions.question: The AWS Cost Management tools give users the ability to do which of the following? (Choose two.)

options.text: Terminate all AWS resources automatically if budget thresholds are exceeded.
Break down AWS costs by day, service, and linked AWS account.
Create budgets and receive notifications if current of forecasted usage exceeds the budgets.
Switch automatically to Reserved Instances or Spot Instances, whichever is most cost-effective.
Move data stored in Amazon S3 to a more cost-effective storage class.

questions.explanation: AWS Cost Management tools allow users to analyze spending by service and account and set budgets with alerts when thresholds are exceeded.

questions.question: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, the security and patching of the guest operating system is the responsibility of:
questions.explanation: Customers are responsible for securing and patching the guest operating system on their EC2 instances.

questions.question: Which AWS service makes it easy to create and manage AWS users and groups, and provide them with secure access to AWS resources at no charge?
questions.explanation: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) enables the creation and management of users, groups, and permissions at no additional cost.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides on-demand of AWS security and compliance documentation?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact provides on-demand access to compliance reports, agreements, and security documentation.

questions.question: Which AWS service can be used to turn text into life-like speech?
questions.explanation: Amazon Polly converts written text into natural-sounding speech using deep learning technologies.

questions.question: What is one of the core principles to follow when designing a highly available application in the AWS Cloud?

options.text: Assume that all components within an application can fail
Design AWS Auto Scaling into every application
Design all components using open-source code

questions.explanation: Highly available systems are designed with the assumption that components will fail, allowing for fault-tolerant architectures.

questions.question: A user needs to generate a report that outlines the status of key security checks in an AWS account. The report must include:
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor provides security check reports that highlight risks and best practice violations.

questions.question: Which Amazon EC2 pricing model should be used to comply with per-core software license requirements?
questions.explanation: Dedicated Hosts allow customers to use per-core or per-socket software licenses by providing dedicated physical servers.

questions.question: Which of the AWS global infrastructure is used to cache copies of content for faster delivery to users across the globe?
questions.explanation: Edge locations cache copies of content closer to users, enabling faster global content delivery.

questions.question: Using AWS Config to record, audit, and evaluate changes to AWS resources to enable traceability is an example of which AWS Well-Architected Framework pillar?
questions.explanation: Using AWS Config to track and audit resource changes supports the Security pillar by ensuring traceability and compliance.
